We‚Äôre currently inviting applications for our new Chair. The successful applicant will champion our work to address inequality, embrace diversity and support inclusion within the UK‚Äôs healthcare systems.

The Chair‚Äôs role is to provide leadership to the GMC‚Äôs Council. They will engage with leaders of the medical profession and health services, and governments in all four UK countries, and members of the public, acting as an ambassador for safe patient care.

@GeeMcLachlan 2/ We do recognise however that being recorded isn‚Äôt always comfortable for doctors. Where a recording is done without prior discussion, talking to the patient, exploring any underlying concerns & explaining that covert recording isn‚Äôt necessary could form part of their approach.

@GeeMcLachlan 1/ Hi Greta. Recordings can be a valuable tool to help patients absorb often complex information over time. In our Decision making and consent guidance (para 27c), we do make clear that doctors should accommodate patients‚Äô wishes if they would like to record a discussion.

Dame Clare's advice for being an inclusive #leader: reach out of your comfort zone to listen to all colleagues, ask 'who am I not hearing from?' and remember that just because someone is quietly working away, it doesn't mean they don't need your support and attention #GMCconf20

We also know that more can be done to ensure greater representation of BAME patients in medical teaching. We plan to work with @ukmedschools on guidance that includes ethnically diverse examples and increase our focus on this area with medical schools in the coming months.

Changes to close gaps in training outcomes are also overdue. We‚Äôve generated a lot of understanding through our research - now it‚Äôs time to see results as we put findings into practice with our partners: https://t.co/0NU8Ab5s5w

All doctors need work environments that are fully supportive & where they know they can raise concerns. Our Fair to Refer? report calls on leaders to hold inclusive engagement sessions with staff & employers to embed performance indicators on compassionate & inclusive leadership.

We know isolating work patterns & poor inductions are part of what drives workplace inequality. Acting on research by @DrDoyinA and @rogerkline, we‚Äôre working with employers to ensure safeguards are in place & local processes are fair & free from bias https://t.co/c01kt7lVGO
